ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.2_0: At that time the monks of Āḷavī, while doing building work, felled a tree.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.3_0: And they cut down trees and had them cut down.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.4_0: Then, when a certain monk was cutting down a tree, the deity that lived in it said to him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.5_0: “Venerable, don’t cut down our dwelling because you want to build a dwelling for yourself.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.6_0: Then that mendicant did not cut down the creeper of that boy throat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.8_0: “Perhaps I should just kill this monk?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.10_0: “It wouldn’t be appropriate for me to just kill this monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.11_0: Let me tell the Buddha about this.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.12_0: And it approached the Buddha and told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.15_0: If he kills him, make much bad karma.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.16_0: The tree in such-and-such a spot is empty; take that as your dwelling.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.17_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.18_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics cut down trees and have them cut down? They are harming life with one sense faculty, and
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.19_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.20_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.21_0: “How can those monks cut down at the root of a tree and have them cut down?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.22_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.25_0: “... Foolish men, how can you cut down trees and have them cut down?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.27_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.28_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.29.1_0: ‘If a monk destroys plants, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.2_0: there are five kinds of propagation from roots: propagation from roots, propagation from stems, propagation from joints, propagation from cuttings, propagation from seeds.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.4_0: turmeric, ginger, sweet flag, white sweet flag, atis root, black hellebore, khus root, nutgrass, or whatever other plants there are that are produced from roots, that grow from roots—this is called “propagation from roots”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.6_0: the Bodhi tree, the banyan tree, the Indian rock fig, the cluster fig, the Indian cedar, the portia tree, or whatever other plants there are that are produced from stems, that grow from stems—this is called “propagation from stems”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.8_0: sugarcane, bamboo, reed, or whatever other plants there are that are produced from joints, that grow from joints—this is called “propagation from joints”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.10_0: shrubby basil, rajmahal hemp, Vicks plant, or whatever other plants there are that are produced from cuttings, that grow from cuttings—this is called “propagation from cuttings”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.12_0: grains, vegetables, or whatever other plants there are that are produced from seeds, that grow from seeds—this is called “propagation from seeds”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.1_0: If it is capable of propagation, and he perceives that it is capable, or he cuts it down or has it cut down, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he cooks it or has it cooked, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.2_0: If it is capable of propagation, but he is unsure of it, and he cuts it down or has it cut down, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he cooks it or has it cooked, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.3_0: If it is capable of propagation, but he perceives that it is not, and he cuts it down or has it cut down, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he cooks it or has it cooked, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.4_0: If it is not capable of propagation, but he perceives that it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.5_0: If it is not capable of propagation, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.6_0: If it is not capable of propagation, and he perceives that it is not, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.2_0: if he says, “Consider this”, “Give this”, “Bring this”, “There’s need for this”, “Make this allowable;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.4_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.7_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.8_0: The first rule, the training rule on plants, is finished.
